components.description:
A water tap with a red stroke through it, indicating that water is not safe for drinking (non-potable).

May be used at a camp site or other area that has water suitable for cleaning or other non-drinking purposes.
components.title: Non-Potable Water Symbol

description:
A water tap with a red stroke through it, indicating that water is not safe for drinking (non-potable).

May be used at a camp site or other area that has water suitable for cleaning or other non-drinking purposes.
title: Non-Potable Water Symbol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols

bn:00087321v: To drink or imbibe with vigour or relish; to drink copiously; to swallow in large draughts.
To consume a liquid through the mouth.
To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.

bn:00010183n: Kind of liquid which is specifically prepared for human consumption
Any one of various liquids for drinking.
Drinks, or beverages, are liquids specifically prepared for human consumption.

bn:00045342n: A tap is a valve controlling release of liquids or gas.
A valve or tap for controlling flow in plumbing.
Regulated inflow of water, for example for drinking water
A faucet for drawing water from a pipe or cask
A device for controlling the release of a liquid or gas
A valve for controlling the release of water from the supply.
A spout connected to a socket to provide water from the main water supply.
A device used to dispense liquids.
A device applied to the end of a pipe in order to interrupt and regulate the flow of a liquid or gas.

bn:00071766n: A bowl for washing hands, dishwashing or other purposes, often affixed to a wall.
A basin used for holding water for washing
Bowl for washing, often affixed to a wall.
A bowl for washing, often affixed to a wall.
A sink is a bowl-shaped plumbing fixture used for washing hands, for dishwashing or other purposes.
Plumbing fixture consisting of a water basin fixed to a wall or floor and having a drainpipe

bn:00042379n: Chemical compound formed of molecules composed of two atoms of hydrogen and one of oxygen

Binary compound that occurs at room temperature as a clear colorless odorless tasteless liquid; freezes into ice below 0 degrees centigrade and boils above 100 degrees centigrade; widely used as a solvent
The liquid form of this chemical; liquid H?O.
Common liquid (H?O) which forms rain, rivers, the sea, etc., and which makes up a large part of the bodies of organisms.
Water is a common chemical substance, that is essential to all known forms of life.
Water is a transparent fluid which forms the world's streams, lakes, oceans and rain, and is the major constituent of the fluids of living things.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the non-potable water emoji is depicted as a clear droplet with a stark red 'X' superimposed, executed with Apple's characteristic high-gloss finish and precise 3D rendering. The sharp contrast and clean lines emphasize its meaning of caution and prohibition, typical of Apple's intuitive icon design. This symbol, as it appears on Apple devices, is universally understood to warn against unsafe water or to signify something undrinkable.
